meanings.definition: a technique used to track the distribution of radioactive substances in a sample
meanings.sent1: Scientists used autoradiographies to see where the radioactive substances were in the sample.
meanings.sent2: The autoradiographies revealed the exact locations of the radioactive elements in the specimen.
meanings.sent3: The autoradiographies played hide and seek with the radioactive particles in the sample.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an autoradiography, each thought glowing brightly in its own unique spot.
meanings.sent5: The autoradiographies painted a vivid picture of the radioactive distribution in the sample.

meanings.sent1: The autoradiographies captured the images of the radioactive substances in stunning detail.
meanings.sent2: Researchers analyzed the autoradiographies to understand the visual representation of the radioactive elements.
meanings.sent3: The autoradiographies decided to have a photoshoot to show off their radioactive images.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like autoradiographies, each image etched clearly in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The autoradiographies displayed a clear picture of the radioactive distribution in the sample.

meanings.sent1: The autoradiographies involved careful steps to create accurate images of the radioactive substances.
meanings.sent2: Scientists perfected the autoradiographies to ensure precise results in creating the images.
meanings.sent3: Creating autoradiographies felt like painting with invisible ink on the sample.
meanings.sent4: Her journey was an autoradiography, each step leaving a trace of her presence.
meanings.sent5: The autoradiographies showcased the meticulous process of creating the radioactive images.
